citations.narrative:
***On or about June 1, 2024, there was public observation of an adult female and a toddler in the back of a pickup in the
drive through portion of the park. While stopping in the giraffe portion of the park, a giraffe lowered its head into the bed of
the pickup to get food from the toddler. As the giraffe lifted its head, the toddler was lifted up out of the pickup
approximately 2-3' and then dropped as the adult female caught the toddler.
According to the facility representative, he believes that the giraffe had hold of the bag of food as did the toddler. He
believes that the toddler let go of the food container as soon as she started to rise.
Failure to provide sufficient distance or barriers between animals and the public increases the risk of injury to both the
animals and the public.
The licensee must ensure that there is sufficient distance or barriers in place to assure the safety of animals and the
public as required.
The facility had changed the policy at the time of inspection to no longer allow riding in the back of pickups in the park.
This must remain corrected from June 11, 2024, forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
***On or about June 1, 2024, there was public observation of an adult female and a toddler in the back of a pickup in the 
drive through portion of the park. While stopping in the giraffe portion of the park, a giraffe lowered its head into the bed of 
the pickup to get food from the toddler. As the giraffe lifted its head, the toddler was lifted up out of the pickup 
approximately 2-3' and then dropped as the adult female caught the toddler.  
According to the facility representative, he believes that the giraffe had hold of the bag of food as did the toddler. He 
believes that the toddler let go of the food container as soon as she started to rise. 
Failure to provide sufficient distance or barriers between animals and the public increases the risk of injury to both the 
animals and the public. 
The licensee must ensure that there is sufficient distance or barriers in place to assure the safety of animals and the 
public as required.  
The facility had changed the policy at the time of inspection to no longer allow riding in the back of pickups in the park. 
This must remain corrected from June 11, 2024, forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
